blog.name: scottishaccentsareawesome
blog.title: *Cue "Boys of Summer" Intro...*
blog.description: She/Her! MCU-addict (specializes in loving Tony Stark and the Stark Family, including but not limited to IronDad & Spider-Son and Pepperony)! Loves Harringrove and Stranger Things but doesn't have Netflix (figure that one out)! Loves Dean WInchester, Brooke Davis, Tony Dinozzo, Jake Peralta, Tahani Al Jamil, The Doctor, Han Solo, Jim Kirk, Kara Danvers, Barry Allen, and MOST of the characters that come with all of them!

summary: (Everyone has gathered at the compound, including: the Avengers,Spider-Man, The Guardians, T’Challa, Captain Marvel, and Loki)...
body:
(Everyone has gathered at the compound, including: the Avengers,Spider-Man, The Guardians, T’Challa, Captain Marvel, and Loki)

Tony(to Steve):…Y’know, you may not even be the prettiest one here.

Steve(gasps): YOU SHUT YOUR MOUTH!

reblog.comment:
(Everyone has gathered at the compound, including: the Avengers,Spider-Man, The Guardians, T’Challa, Captain Marvel, and Loki)

Tony(to Steve):…Y’know, you may not even be the prettiest one here.

Steve(gasps): YOU SHUT YOUR MOUTH!

trail.content_raw:
(Everyone has gathered at the compound, including: the Avengers,Spider-Man, The Guardians, T’Challa, Captain Marvel, and Loki)

Tony(to Steve):…Y’know, you may not even be the prettiest one here.

Steve(gasps): YOU SHUT YOUR MOUTH!
trail.content:
(Everyone has gathered at the compound, including: the Avengers,Spider-Man, The Guardians, T’Challa, Captain Marvel, and Loki)

Tony(to Steve):…Y’know, you may not even be the prettiest one here.

Steve(gasps): YOU SHUT YOUR MOUTH!

summary: Steve: ...Guess who just made out with Sharon Carter behind the compound? Tony: Anyone with a quarter? Steve: No, me! Clint:...
body:
Steve: …Guess who just made out with Sharon Carter behind the compound?

Tony: Anyone with a quarter?

Steve: No, me!

Clint: Damn, and I had a quarter…!

summary: Tony: For this mission, I wore the perfect disguise to make sure I was never noticed by anyone. Something so drab and...
body:
Tony: For this mission, I wore the perfect disguise to make sure I was never noticed by anyone. Something so drab and uninspiring-

Steve: I feel this is going to be a dig at me.

Tony: I wore Steve’s clothes.

Steve: There it is.

summary: Been There, Blown That Up - Chapter 2 - GwendolynStacy
title: Been There, Blown That Up - Chapter 2 - GwendolynStacy
description:
Fandom: Marvel, The Avengers, Marvel Cinematic Universe

Category: Gen

Relationships:  Tony Stark & Nebula, Nebula & Gamora

Characters: Nebula, Tony Stark, Gamora, Thanos

Additional Tags: Time Travel, Friendship, Humor, Fix It

Summary: Tony handles his arrival in the past as well as can be expected considering the circumstances. The same cannot be said for Nebula, who loses her cool approximately two seconds after laying eyes on Thanos.

summary: Can you do Tony Stark for the character breakdown?
question: Can you do Tony Stark for the character breakdown?
answer:
YES I CAN! THANK YOU! *^* (Seriously, I thought the amount of Marvel-related asks would increase after I started writing for it. Because I have a shit-ton of opinions and headcanons for Marvel xDDD)

How I feel about this character: I LOVE MY TIN-MAN. *-*

All the people I ship romantically with this character: AA!Steve or EMH!Steve or just generally not-MCU!Steve. Loki. Bucky. T’Challa. Peter Quill. Strange. Sam. Thor. But honestly, if you were to put a new shiny ship in front of me involving Tony, I’d give it a try, as long as it’s not a NOTP of mine.

My brOTP for this character: JAMES ‘RHODEY’ RHODES. The number one Tony Stan who will physically fight any Tony Anti. Also; Pepper Potts and Bruce Banner.

My unpopular opinion about this character: I mean. Depending on what side of the fandom you shout it at; Tony Stark is a good character with good character development and growth and the MCU hinges on him. ;D

One thing I wish would happen / had happened with this character in canon: I wish he’d have gotten a new team of Avengers in the two year time gap between CW and IW. I mean. It’s pathetic and ridiculous to imagine Tony, Vision and a still injured Rhodey are… all… there was for the past two years?? In universe wise it makes zero sense. But sure. Marvel had to rush the movie schedule along. They should have taken the time to make another Avengers movie between those two to establish that Earth was still protected by… more than three heroes… like. Seriously. You didn’t even necessarily have to introduce new characters. Make Jane Thor, based on some mumbo-jumbo comic logic that when the Aether was inside her, it left some energy. Put Sharon Carter on that team. Strange could have approached them, knowing Earth needs defending. Hope van Dyne shoulda joined after Scott fucked off with the suit to break his parole. And bahm, you’d have seven Avengers, none of them being new characters, but making it believable in-universe wise. Because lemme tell you, it is not believable that with all the super-powered and special-trained people running around in the MCU that the Avengers remained a three men band for two fucking years. And I WISH we would have gotten that Avengers movie where Tony recruits a new team to fight maybe a mediocre threat of sorts. Just for team-establishment and also female empowerment, seriously stop writing all your females out of the franchise, Marvel, it’s starting to look HIGHLY suspicious.

blog.name: spideadpoolfacts
blog.title: Spidey & Deadpool Facts
blog.description: Anecdotes and random facts about our favorite web-slinger & merc, with guest appearances from other Marvel characters from time to time. Serious stuff to help fanfic writers in their characterisation, fun facts to get a laugh at our heroes' expense, and the occasionnal out-of context comic pannel. | Header by dankrobotowl.

summary: Fandom: Marvel Words: 829 A/N: The only good thing to come out of Infinity War was IronStrange and the fact that Stephen has...
body:
Fandom: Marvel

Words: 829

A/N: The only good thing to come out of Infinity War was IronStrange and the fact that Stephen has casual clothes. Thank you @csi-baker-street-babes for this prompt that somehow I turned to fluff? I’m a monster.

The Sanctum Sanctorum or, as Tony referred to it, Hogwarts was a breath of fresh air compared to what Tony was used to. Stark Tower and even the Avengers Compound was the peak of humanity’s technological advances as far as Tony knew (he had yet to see Wakanda) and the Sanctorum was the exact opposite: Rustic, ancient… A well preserved temple. There was modernized technology here and there - plumbing and electrical lighting - yet the tomes that made up the walls, fireplaces in the larger rooms, and natural lighting from windows, not to mention the various candles, gave the place a nice antique atmosphere that was surprisingly relaxing to the Iron Man.

He didn’t get to visit often due to his own busy schedule, not to mention Stephen’s Sorcerer Supreme duties that he had yet to explain in full. But this weekend was one of the rare occurrences that either had absolutely nothing planned, and if Tony didn’t leave his own place he would only end up locking himself in the lab until something needed his attention.

But at the moment he was exploring the large and consistently warm building, dressed in nothing more than an oversized gray knitted sweater - courtesy of Stephen’s wardrobe - and a pair of black Stark Industries boxers, not to mention the lovely dark spots left all over his neck and shoulders. In his hands was a half-full mug of non-caffienated tea left for him on the bedside table when he woke, one wizard missing from his morning routine. He was currently looking for said magic man, but didn’t mind getting lost in the exquisite architecture.

He finally stumbled upon Strange in a mostly empty room with a large window pouring in early afternoon sun, the sorcerer levitating with crossed legs in the natural spotlight with his eyes closed, hands resting in his lap. Tony deposited his mostly empty mug on the small table by the open door before sneaking up behind the unsuspecting man and slithered his arms around his chest, pressing his face into his back that smelled of the old books and the tea he just consumed. Stephen released a content sigh through his nostrils and slightly parted lips to let the attention-needy billionaire that his presence was acknowledged but remained silence otherwise. Tony pulled down his baggy T-shirt to press kisses on the bare skin, from the top of his spine up his neck. A low hum reverberated from Stephen’s throats, but he kept his eyes closed.

“Stephen,” Tony rumbled just beside his ear before placing a kiss behind it, having to stand on his tiptoes to reach Stephen’s elevated height. “Stephen,” he repeated in a singsong, hands now pressed to his chest. He grinned when he noticed the faintest smile on his lover’s lips, his own touching his cheek. “Doctor,” he half growled, half purred. His grin grew wicked and predatory when Stephen shuddered before his eyelids finally revealed the green eyes underneath, his expression remained stoic but his dilated pupils revealed the truth. His hands came up to hold Tony’s, lifting them so he could kiss each finger.

“You really know how to bother someone until you’re given what you’re wanted,” he mumbled against his skin before placing the final kiss on his pinky.

“It’s called business,” Tony retorted with a smirk, eyes going half-lidded when he finally received his good morning kiss, smiling through their pressed lips. “Let’s go back to bed,” he whined, hands tugging on his shirt, “We don’t have anything else to do today.”

“I don’t plan on staying in bed all day,” Stephen chuckled, hands running through Tony’s hair when he pouted. “You can stay with me here if you’d like.”

“Trust me, I’m not leaving your side unless I absolutely have to,” Tony assured with stubbornness that made Stephen only love him more. “But do me a favor?” Stephen quirked his brow curiously, inclining him to ask. “Can you come down?” Stephen glanced at the floor to see he was still hovering, Tony’s feet lifted off the ground as he clung to him. He did everything in his power to not burst out with laughter as he stretched his legs to touch the ground, though Tony made no move to release him.

They eventually ended on the ground, Stephen resuming his previous position minus the levitation and with Tony’s head resting in his lap. They basked in the sunlight in comfortable silence, only broken by the sound of their grumbling stomachs and embarrassed yet loving giggles. Tony didn’t want to move, at least not for another hour, but Stephen wasn’t about to let him suffer from a hunger-induced headache. It took Stephen bridal carrying Tony out of the room and through the Sanctum with very weak protests and an unconvincing pout for him to comply. Pepper did warn him of Tony’s reluctance to accepting affection, or at least his admittal that he enjoyed the physical attention. But Stephen wouldn’t have him any other way.

A/N: I’m gonna tag the people in the original post’s notes who said they wanted this so @strangelyiron @actuallyspooderman hope y’all enjoy this.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: When the Brooklyn Boys Begin
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2LIMLUw

by fullarmorandahotfudgesundae

Steve just wanted to die in peace. An Omega without children, who couldn’t have children, living for long after their Alpha was torn from them?

Not happening, not even with modern medicine.

So, having accepted his fate, why was he suddenly haunted by a hallucination of his dead Alpha? A really firm, tactile, weepy hallucination of his dead Alpha?

Maybe he should just roll with it?

(Bucky, for his part, just wants to know what the hell is going on and how he and his punk Omega managed to be alive in the twenty-first century. Oh, and also how to stop that little issue of the bond sickness killing his Stevie.)

Words: , Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

Series: Part 1 of Hot Time in the Town of Berlin

  • Fandoms: Captain America (Movies), The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M, M/M
  • Characters: James “Bucky” Barnes, Steve Rogers, Tony Stark, Bruce Banner, Pepper Potts, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Clint Barton
  • Relationships: James “Bucky” Barnes/Steve Rogers, Pepper Potts/Tony Stark, Clint Barton/Natasha Romanov, Bruce Banner/Betty Ross, kind of - Relationship
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Canon Divergence - Post-Avengers (2012), Alpha/Beta/Omega Dynamics, Alpha Bucky Barnes, Omega Steve Rogers, Alpha Tony Stark, Beta Pepper Potts, “It’s Complicated” Bruce Banner, Omega Natasha Romanov, Beta Clint Barton, Soul Bond, Seriously What is Canon?, Handwavy Science, Getting Our Boys Back Together Earlier, Genre Typical Non-Con Hinted, Thanks Hydra


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2LIMLUw

by fullarmorandahotfudgesundae

Steve just wanted to die in peace. An Omega without children, who couldn’t have children, living for long after their Alpha was torn from them?

Not happening, not even with modern medicine.

So, having accepted his fate, why was he suddenly haunted by a hallucination of his dead Alpha? A really firm, tactile, weepy hallucination of his dead Alpha?

Maybe he should just roll with it?

(Bucky, for his part, just wants to know what the hell is going on and how he and his punk Omega managed to be alive in the twenty-first century. Oh, and also how to stop that little issue of the bond sickness killing his Stevie.)
